subtopics.title: Homeschool Performance
subtopics.description: Comparative analysis of homeschool students' academic performance across various subjects and testing categories.

clusters.title: Homeschooling Success
clusters.description: Homeschooled students consistently outperform their peers from public, private, and charter schools in various academic areas, including adjusted total, verbal, quantitative, and writing scores. They score significantly higher, with differences ranging from 1.3 to 80.5 points depending on the comparison group and subject. Their scores often place them in the 70th to 80th percentile, and they perform one grade level above their peers in grades 1 to 4. Despite these achievements, homeschooled students score lower than private independent school averages. Homeschooling costs range from $700 to $1,800 per student annually.

related_facts.fact_group_content: 73 percent of homeschooling parents are dissatisfied with the academic instruction available in local schools.
83% of parents of homeschooled children cite concern about the school environment as a reason.
25% of parents cited concern about school environment as the most important reason for homeschooling.
15% of parents cited dissatisfaction with academic instruction at other schools as the most important reason for homeschooling.
75% of parents cite preference to provide moral instruction as a reason.
72% of parents cite the desire to emphasize family life together as a reason.
53% of parents cite the desire to provide religious instruction as a reason.
13% of parents cited a desire to provide religious instruction as the most important reason for homeschooling.
50% of parents cite the desire to provide a nontraditional approach to education as a reason.
21% of parents cite their child's special needs as a reason for homeschooling.
15% of parents of homeschooling children cite a physical or mental health problem as a reason for homeschooling.
2% of parents cite a temporary illness as a reason for homeschooling.

clusters.title: Homeschooling Motivations
clusters.description: A significant number of parents choose homeschooling due to concerns about school environments (83%) and dissatisfaction with academic instruction (73%). Many parents also prefer homeschooling to provide moral (75%) and religious (53%) instruction, emphasize family life (72%), or adopt nontraditional educational approaches (50%). Health issues (15%) and special needs (21%) are less common reasons. The primary reasons cited include school environment concerns (25%) and dissatisfaction with academic instruction (15%).
